result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Ryan McKenna was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew Ryan McKenna is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew Ryan McKenna was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Matthew Ryan McKenna was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed, signed Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge McAdams, Br 7, for review. os

Sentencing proceeded as to count THREE:   Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for ZERO DAYS  time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for ONE YEAR with the following conditions:
*COCAINE TREATMENT, RANDOM URINE SCREENS
*PAY ALL COSTS, FEES AND SURCHARGES DURING TERM OF PROBATION OR CIVIL JUDGMENT SHALL BE ENTERED AGAINST THE DEFENDANT 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Matthew Ryan Mckenna in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS ONE AND THREE: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT TWO:  DISMISSED 

Sentencing proceeded AS TO COUNT ONE: 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 75 DAYS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0  days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply FOR WORK AND TREATMENT. COURT STAYED THE COMMENCMENT UNTIL 6-18-15. 

Fine of $ 350.00 PLUS ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND SURCHARGES to be paid by 6-11-16  or serve 25 CONSECUTIVE  days in the House of Correction.

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for ONE YEAR  with the mandatory reinstatement fee.

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of  ONE YEAR  thereafter. 

AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.

Defendant Matthew Ryan Mckenna in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Scott Phillips unavailable this afternoon.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch
47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew Ryan Mckenna in court with attorney  Scott Phillips.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-07-2015 at 01:30 pm.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew Ryan Mckenna

Prior: 14782 West Hidden Creek Court, New Berlin, WI 53151

Defendant Matthew Ryan Mckenna in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.47  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/4/15 @ 1 PM
